data.title: Pistons bring aboard PG John Lucas III
authors: Vince Ellis, and Kirkland Crawford, Detroit Free Press
data.meta_description: The Pistons are nearing an agreement with point guard John Lucas III on a 10-day contract, according to a source.
data.text:
The Detroit Pistons today signed point guard John Lucas III to a 10-day contract.

Lucas, listed at 5-feet-11, is being brought in as insurance behind new starter D.J. Augustin and rookie Spencer Dinwiddie, after starter Brandon Jennings suffered a season-ending left Achilles tear eight days ago in Milwaukee.

One source told the Free Press on Sunday that Lucas would sign and be at practice as soon as today.

Lucas, 32, has bounced around the NBA since his rookie year in 2005, playing with Houston, Chicago, Toronto and Utah, and having stints in Italy, Spain, China and the NBA D-League. He began this season with the Fujian Sturgeons in China.

Last season with the Jazz, he played 42 games, averaging 3.8 points and 1.0 assists. He's also credited for being a mentor to then-rookie Jazz point guard Trey Burke (Michigan).

Lucas is the son of John Lucas, the former NBA No. 1 overall draft pick and coach.
